snippet: The International Energy Agency said on Friday that the tension between Iran and the West would likely keep oil prices high despite an improvement in world supply.
abstract: International Energy Agency says tension between Iran and the West could cut off oil supplies from the Middle East, keeping oil prices high despite improvement in world supply.
lead_paragraph: The International Energy Agency said on Friday that the tension between Iran and the West would likely keep oil prices high despite an improvement in world supply.

headline.seo: Tensions Between Iran and West To Keep Oil Prices High
headline.main: ‘Geopolitical Risks’ Keep Oil Expensive, but Plentiful
headline.print_headline: Oil Seen as Plentiful, but Expensive
